metadata.subject: Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act Abuses at the Department of Justice and the Federal Bureau of Investigation

organizations: House Permanent Select Committee on Intelligence

relationships.description: Steele was paid by DNC and Clinton campaign via Perkins Coie and Fusion GPS to compile opposition research
Ohr's wife was employed by Fusion GPS while Ohr maintained contact with Steele
FBI colleagues with improper text messages demonstrating bias and discussing investigations
Government agencies seeking surveillance warrants from the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Court

transactions: Payment to Christopher Steele by DNC and Clinton campaign

analysis.purpose: To authorize declassification of a memorandum alleging FISA abuses by DOJ and FBI during 2016 election
analysis.significance: Official White House authorization to release classified information about surveillance of Trump campaign advisor Carter Page

concerns: Failure to disclose Steele's bias and funding sources
Unauthorized media disclosures by FBI source

notable_quotes: "The President has determined that declassification of the Memorandum is appropriate"
"Steele admitted to Ohr his feelings against then-candidate Trump when Steele said he 'was desperate that Donald Trump not get elected and was passionate about him not being president'"
"Deputy Director McCabe testified that no surveillance warrant would have been sought from the FISC without the Steele dossier information"
red_flags: Omission of political funding sources in FISA applications
Concealment of Steele's media contacts and bias
Undisclosed relationship between Bruce Ohr and Fusion GPS
Text messages discussing 'insurance' policy against Trump's election

blackmail_indicators.description: No evidence of blackmail or coercion found in this document

illegal_activity.description: Document discusses alleged procedural violations and oversight concerns, not first-hand illegal activity

details: References to Michael Isikoff (Yahoo News) and David Corn (Mother Jones) articles
Discussion of Steele's media contacts and leaks

public_knowledge.context: This memorandum was part of highly publicized congressional investigations into 2016 election surveillance activities

analysis.summary: This document is the White House's formal authorization to declassify a House Intelligence Committee memorandum alleging FISA abuses by the DOJ and FBI in their surveillance of Trump campaign advisor Carter Page, focusing on omissions about the Steele dossier's political origins and biases.
